intro: Erigeron coroniglandifer, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a taproot system and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers with a central disk. Erigeron coroniglandifer is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
